poem:
**In the Shadow of Poison**

The quiet streets,   
once woven with morning threads,  
now hold the dark echo  
of unseen hands. Dawn,  
a name breathed softly,  
lost in whispers of a nation  
that looks but does not see,  
learns but does not hold.   
In the lightless corner of memory,  
her shadow lives,  
reminding us of frailty.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
